DOC.brief_summary: This is a descriptive study of patients with Lymphangioleiomyomatosis and precapillary pulmonary hypertension.
DOC.detailed_description: Descriptive study of patients with Lymphangioleiomyomatosis and precapillary pulmonary hypertension This will include modality of diagnosis of lLymphangioleiomyomatosis, results of right-sided heart catheterization, and pulmonary function tests
DOC.criteria: Lymphangioleiomyomatosis (definite or probable), either sporadic or associated with tuberous sclerosis Precapillary pulmonary hypertension, as defined by rightsided heart catheterization (mean pulmonary artery pressure higher than 25 mmHg, wedge capillary pulmonary pressure less than 15 mmHg, pulmonary vascular resistance higher than 3 Wood units) Post capillary pulmonary hypertension Other identifiable causes of pulmonary hypertension (ex: thromboembolic disease) Not willing to participate
